nodes.text: Audience Speaker : I’m coming from a place where growing up in England, coming to a Scottish university, I was very pro the union
Asserting
Lucas is coming from a place where growing up in England, coming to a Scottish university, he was very pro the union
Kamila: Audience Speaker : I’m coming from a place where growing up in England, coming to a Scottish university, I was very pro the union
Audience Speaker : All my Scottish friends that I’ve made here at uni are all pro-independence
Asserting
all of Lucas's Scottish friends that he's made at uni are all pro-independence
Kamila: Audience Speaker : All my Scottish friends that I’ve made here at uni are all pro-independence
Audience Speaker : on the point made that it’s important that we look for health and healing and ambitions and prosperity
Asserting
on the point made that it’s important that we look for health and healing and ambitions and prosperity
Kamila: Audience Speaker : on the point made that it’s important that we look for health and healing and ambitions and prosperity
Default Transition
Default Transition

Audience Speaker : what most of my friends say is the opportunities for Scotland outside of the United Kingdom, potentially being back in the European Union or making their own way, as the UK and Britain have said we’re going to do outside the union ourselves
Asserting

what most of Lucas's friends say is the opportunities for Scotland outside of the United Kingdom, potentially being back in the European Union or making their own way, as the UK and Britain have said we’re going to do outside the union ourselves

Kamila: Audience Speaker : what most of my friends say is the opportunities for Scotland outside of the United Kingdom, potentially being back in the European Union or making their own way, as the UK and Britain have said we’re going to do outside the union ourselves
Default Transition

Audience Speaker : Those opportunities are so much greater than if we’re stuck here in the United Kingdom and being consistently held back by Westminster that continues to prioritise London over any other part of the UK
Asserting

opportunities for Scotland are so much greater than Scotland is stuck here in the United Kingdom and being consistently held back by Westminster that continues to prioritise London over any other part of the UK

Kamila: Audience Speaker : Those opportunities are so much greater than if we’re stuck here in the United Kingdom and being consistently held back by Westminster that continues to prioritise London over any other part of the UK
Default Transition
Default Inference
Arguing
